{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} There were a number of groups in Iraq opposed to the regime of [[Saddam Hussein]].
[[Image:LittleIraq.png]]
They can be roughly divided into three groups: *[[Shi'a]] groups in the south *[[Kurd]]s in the north, organizing Iraqi [[Kurdistan]] since 1991 *[[Arab]] opposition groups suppressed in [[Baghdad]] Groups include: * the umbrella group [[Iraqi National Congress]] * Three [[Kurd]]ish factions: ** [[Kurdistan Democratic Party]] ** [[Patriotic Union of Kurdistan]] ** [[Islamic Movement of Kurdistan]] * the [[monarchist]] group the [[Constitutional Monarchy Movement]] * the [[Iraqi National Accord]] * the [[Iran]]-supported Iraqi [[Shi'a]] groups [[Supreme Islamic Iraqi Council]] and [[Islamic Dawa Party]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Iraqi Anti-Saddam Hussein Groups}} [[Category:Politics of Iraq]] [[Category:History of Iraq]]
